name: hubspot
label: HubSpot
description: HubSpot is a CRM platform with all the software, integrations, and resources you need to connect marketing, sales, content management, and customer service. This integration is used to get, create, update or delete a ticket.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: resource
fields.tooltip: The service-based URI to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.description: The service-based URI to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: Client ID
fields.name: client_id
fields.tooltip: Unique APP ID of the HubSpot application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.
fields.description: Unique APP ID of the HubSpot application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

fields.title: Client Secret
fields.name: client_secret
fields.tooltip: Unique APP Secret of the HubSpot application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.
fields.description: Unique APP Secret of the HubSpot application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

fields.title: Authorization Code
fields.name: code
fields.tooltip: The authorization code that you acquired during the authorization step.
fields.description: The authorization code that you acquired from this URL replacing CLIENT_ID and REDIRECT_URI 'https://app.hubspot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=CLIENT_ID&redirect_uri=REDIRECT_URI&scope=oauth%20tickets'.

fields.title: Redirect URL
fields.description: The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. It must exactly match one of the redirect_uri you registered in the app registration portal.
fields.name: redirect_uri
fields.tooltip: The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. It must exactly match one of the redirect_uri you registered in the app registration.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description:
Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.
By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Get All Tickets
operations.description: Retrieves the list of all tickets from HubSpot maximum up to 100 per request. You can get more detailed list by specifying input parameters.

parameters.title: Ticket Properties
parameters.name: properties
parameters.tooltip: Comma-separated list of ticket properties to include in the response.
parameters.description: Specify the Ticket Properties or a comma-separated list of Ticket Properties to included in the response (e.g., subject, content, hs_pipeline, hs_pipeline_stage).

parameters.title: Ticket Properties With History
parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.tooltip: Comma-separated list of ticket properties to include in the response with full version history.
parameters.description: This parameter behaves exactly like the properties parameter above, with the exception that properties included with this parameter also return the full version history for the property.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: offset
parameters.tooltip: Used to get the next set of results. If hasMore is true in the previous response, you use the returned offset value to get the next set of records.
parameters.description: Used to get the next set of results. If hasMore is true in the previous response, you use the returned offset value to get the next set of records.

operations.title: Get Tickets By ID
operations.description: Retrieves specific tickets from HubSpot based on the Ticket ID(s) and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket ID
parameters.name: ticket_ids
parameters.tooltip: Comma-separated list of Ticket IDs. You can include up to 100 IDs in a single request
parameters.description: Specify the Ticket ID or a comma-separated list of Ticket IDs to retrieve from the HubSpot.

parameters.title: Ticket Properties
parameters.name: properties
parameters.tooltip: Comma-separated list of ticket properties to include in the response.
parameters.description: Specify the Ticket Properties or a comma-separated list of Ticket Properties to included in the response (e.g., subject, content, hs_pipeline, hs_pipeline_stage).

parameters.title: Ticket Properties With History
parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.tooltip: Comma-separated list of ticket properties to include in the response with full version history.
parameters.description: This parameter behaves exactly like the properties parameter above, with the exception that properties included with this parameter also return the full version history for the property.

parameters.title: Include Deleted
parameters.name: includeDeletes
parameters.tooltip: Select to retrieve deleted records. By default, deleted records will not be returned by the API.
parameters.description: You can check this box to retrieve even the deleted records. By default, deleted records will not be returned by the API.

operations.title: Create Tickets
operations.description: Creates a new Ticket(s) with the ticket properties based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Create
parameters.name: create
parameters.description: Create a 'Single Ticket' or 'Multiple Tickets'. Up to 100 tickets can be created in a single request.

Single Ticket.title: Ticket Name
Single Ticket.name: subject
Single Ticket.tooltip: Specify the name of the ticket you want to create on HubSpot.
Single Ticket.description: Specify the name of the ticket you want to create on HubSpot.

Single Ticket.title: Pipeline
Single Ticket.name: hs_pipeline
Single Ticket.tooltip: Specify the ID of the pipeline the ticket is in.
Single Ticket.description: Specify the ID of the pipeline the ticket is in.

Single Ticket.title: Ticket Status
Single Ticket.name: hs_pipeline_stage
Single Ticket.tooltip: Specify the ticket's stage in its pipeline.
Single Ticket.description: Specify the ticket's stage in its pipeline.

Single Ticket.title: Ticket Description
Single Ticket.name: content
Single Ticket.tooltip: Specify the description about the ticket you want to create on HubSpot
Single Ticket.description: Specify the description about the ticket you want to create on HubSpot

Single Ticket.title: Source
Single Ticket.name: source_type
Single Ticket.tooltip: Select the channel where ticket was originally submitted.
Single Ticket.description: Select the channel where ticket was originally submitted.

Single Ticket.title: Ticket Owner
Single Ticket.name: hubspot_owner_id
Single Ticket.tooltip: Specify the ID of the owner of the ticket.
Single Ticket.description: Specify the ID of the owner of the ticket.

Single Ticket.title: Priority
Single Ticket.name: hs_ticket_priority
Single Ticket.tooltip: Select the level of attention needed on the ticket.
Single Ticket.description: Select the level of attention needed on the ticket.

Single Ticket.title: Create Date
Single Ticket.name: createdate
Single Ticket.tooltip: Specify the creation date of the ticket. By default its created with current date and time.
Single Ticket.description: Specify the creation date of the ticket. By default its created with current date and time.

Single Ticket.name: ticket_properties
Single Ticket.title: Other Properties
Single Ticket.description: Specify a list of additional ticket properties you want to set for new ticket.
Single Ticket.tooltip: A list of additional ticket properties you want to set for new ticket.

Multiple Tickets.name: ticket_properties
Multiple Tickets.title: Ticket Properties
Multiple Tickets.description: Specify an array of list of ticket properties you want to set for each new ticket. You must set the ticket pipeline and stage when creating a new ticket.
Multiple Tickets.tooltip: An array of list of ticket properties you want to set for each new ticket. You must set the ticket pipeline and stage when creating a new ticket.

operations.title: Update Tickets
operations.description: Updates the ticket properties of a Ticket(s) based on the Ticket ID(s) you have specified.

parameters.title: Update
parameters.name: update
parameters.description: Update a 'Single Ticket' or 'Multiple Tickets'. Up to 100 tickets can be updated in a single request.

Single Ticket.title: Ticket ID
Single Ticket.name: ticket_id
Single Ticket.tooltip: Specify the ID of the ticket you want to update on HubSpot.
Single Ticket.description: Specify the ID of the ticket you want to update on HubSpot.

Single Ticket.title: Ticket Name
Single Ticket.name: subject
Single Ticket.tooltip: Specify the new name of the ticket you want to be updated on HubSpot.
Single Ticket.description: Specify the new name of the ticket you want to be updated on HubSpot.

Single Ticket.title: Pipeline
Single Ticket.name: hs_pipeline
Single Ticket.tooltip: Specify the new ID of the pipeline the ticket is in to update on HubSpot.
Single Ticket.description: Specify the new ID of the pipeline the ticket is in to update on HubSpot.

Single Ticket.title: Ticket Status
Single Ticket.name: hs_pipeline_stage
Single Ticket.tooltip: Specify the new ticket's stage in its pipeline to be updated on HubSpot.
Single Ticket.description: Specify the new ticket's stage in its pipeline to be updated on HubSpot.

Single Ticket.title: Ticket Description
Single Ticket.name: content
Single Ticket.tooltip: Specify the new description about the ticket you want to update on HubSpot
Single Ticket.description: Specify the new description about the ticket you want to update on HubSpot

Single Ticket.title: Source
Single Ticket.name: source_type
Single Ticket.tooltip: Select the channel where ticket was originally submitted to update on HubSpot.
Single Ticket.description: Select the channel where ticket was originally submitted to update on HubSpot.

Single Ticket.title: Ticket Owner
Single Ticket.name: hubspot_owner_id
Single Ticket.tooltip: Specify the ID of the new owner of the ticket to update on HubSpot.
Single Ticket.description: Specify the ID of the new owner of the ticket to update on HubSpot.

Single Ticket.title: Priority
Single Ticket.name: hs_ticket_priority
Single Ticket.tooltip: Select the new value for level of attention needed on the ticket.
Single Ticket.description: Select the new value for level of attention needed on the ticket.

Single Ticket.title: Create Date
Single Ticket.name: createdate
Single Ticket.tooltip: Specify the creation date of the ticket to be updated on HubSpot.
Single Ticket.description: Specify the creation date of the ticket to be updated on HubSpot.

Single Ticket.name: ticket_properties
Single Ticket.title: Other Properties
Single Ticket.description: Specify a list of additional ticket properties you want to update for the ticket.

Multiple Tickets.name: ticket_properties
Multiple Tickets.title: Ticket Properties
Multiple Tickets.description: Specify an array, with each element containing the ID of the ticket to update and a list of properties to update for that ticket.
Multiple Tickets.tooltip: An array, with each element containing the ID of the ticket to update and a list of properties to update for that ticket.

operations.title: Delete Tickets
operations.description: Deletes the Ticket(s) based on the Ticket ID(s) you have specified.

parameters.title: Ticket ID
parameters.name: ticket_ids
parameters.tooltip: Comma-separated list of Ticket IDs. You can include up to 100 IDs in a single request
parameters.description: Specify the Ticket ID or a comma-separated list of Ticket IDs to delete from the HubSpot.

operations.title: Get Tickets Changes Log
operations.description: Retrieves the list of all the changes made to ticket objects. Returns 1000 (or fewer) changes, starting with the least recent change. Returned changes are limited to the last 24 hours. Changes prior to that period will not be returned.

parameters.title: Timestamp
parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.tooltip: The Timestamp of the last change you pulled. If you are providing Timestamp then provide Change Type and Object ID as well.
parameters.description: The timestamp of the last change you pulled. If you are providing Timestamp then provide Change Type and Object ID as well.

parameters.title: Change Type
parameters.name: change_type
parameters.tooltip: The last Change Type you pulled. If you are providing Change Type then provide Timestamp and Object ID as well.
parameters.description: The last Change Type you pulled. If you are providing Change Type then provide Timestamp and Object ID as well.

parameters.title: Object ID
parameters.name: object_id
parameters.tooltip: The ID of the last object you received changes for. If you are providing Object ID then provide Change Type and Timestamp as well.
parameters.description: The ID of the last object you received changes for. If you are providing Object ID then provide Change Type and Timestamp as well.
